com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class SmartSplashScreenActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartActivity<AggregateClass>
              • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartSplashScreenActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass>
  • Type Parameters:
    AggregateClass - the aggregate class accessible though the SmartActivity.setAggregate(Object) and SmartActivity.getAggregate() methods
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, AppPublics.BroadcastListener, AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic, Smartable<AggregateClass>, SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>, Smarted<AggregateClass>, LifeCycle

    public abstract class SmartSplashScreenActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass>
extends SmartActivity<AggregateClass>
implements AppPublics.BroadcastListener
    A basis activity class which is displayed while the application is loading. The loading of the business objects is synchronous, but in the derived class, if necessary, think of making it asynchronous if necessary, so as to relief the UI.
    Since:
    2010.01.05
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Method Detail

      • isInitialized

        public static java.util.Date isInitialized(java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass)
        Indicates whether an Activity is marked as initialized.
        Parameters:
        activityClass - the class of the splash screen
        Returns:
        a non null date, if and only if the given screen has been initialized ; in that case, the returned date is the timestamp when it has been marked as SmartSplashScreenActivity#markAsInitialized(Class))

      • markAsInitialized

        public static void markAsInitialized(java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Activity> activityClass,
                     boolean isInitialized)
        Indicates whether the provided activity should be considered as initialized.

        This is useful within an application which provides a "reset-to-factory" or "log-out" feature.

        Parameters:
        activityClass - the class of the screen
        isInitialized - the flag which indicates the provided activity initialization status

      • onRetrieveDisplayObjectsCustom

        protected abstract void onRetrieveDisplayObjectsCustom()
        The method that should be overriden, instead of the usual LifeCycle.onRetrieveDisplayObjects() method.

        This method will be invoked just once for the first Activity instance.

        This method is invoked even if an external storage is required and no external storage is available at runtime.

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjectsCustom

        protected abstract BusinessObjectClass onRetrieveBusinessObjectsCustom()
                                                                throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
        The method that should be overriden, instead of the usual LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method.

        This method is not invoked when an external storage is required and no external storage is available at runtime.

        Returns:
        a business object ; may be null
        Throws:
        LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjectsCustomOver

        protected void onRetrieveBusinessObjectsCustomOver(BusinessObjectClass businessObject,
                                       java.lang.Runnable finishRunnable)
        This method will be invoked when the business objects retrieval is over. This is the ideal place to run something, before the splash screen is dismissed.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        It is ensured that this callback will be not be invoked anymore as soon as an instance has Runnable.run() the provided finishRunnable callback.

        The default implementation just invokes the provided finishRunnable Runnable.run() method, which finishes the current splash screen.

        Parameters:
        businessObject - the business object that has been returned by the onRetrieveDisplayObjectsCustom() method ; may be null
        finishRunnable - the callback that should be Runnable.run() as soon as the splash screen should be ended. The provided callback may be invoked from any thread.

      • requiresExternalStorage

        protected boolean requiresExternalStorage()
        Returns:
        true if and only if the application requires an external storage to work

      • onNoExternalStorage

        protected void onNoExternalStorage()
        If the requiresExternalStorage() method returns true and that, at runtime, non external storage is available, this method will be invoked.

        This is a good place to pop-up an error dialog box and prevent the application from resuming. It is ensured that this callback will be invoked from the GUI thread.

      • stopActivity

        protected final void stopActivity()
        Indicates to the splash screen to stop doing anything, prevents the calling Intent from being executed, and considers the splash-screen as uninitialized. Once this method has been invoked, the splash screen will never be able to resume.

        Invoke this method during the method. It may be called from any thread.

        This may be extremely useful if you to integrate a licensing mechanism, for instance.

      • pauseActivity

        protected final void pauseActivity()
        Indicates to the splash screen to pause, and prevents the calling Intent from being executed, and the current Activity from finishing.

        Invoke this method during the method. It may be called from any thread.

        See Also:
        resumeActivity()

      • resumeActivity

        protected final void resumeActivity()
        Indicates to the splash screen to resume: the calling Intent will be executed, and the current Activity will finish.

        Invoke this method during the method. It may be called from any thread.

        See Also:
        pauseActivity()

      • getIntentFilter

        public android.content.IntentFilter getIntentFilter()
        Description copied from interface: AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        This method will be invoked by the framework to determine what IntentFilter should be associated to the current listener.

        The returned value of the method will be used to invoke the Context.registerReceiver(android.content.BroadcastReceiver, IntentFilter) method. If this method is annotated with AppPublics.UseNativeBroadcast, the implementation will use the LocalBroadcastManager implementation.

        Specified by:
        getIntentFilter in interface AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        Returns:
        if not null, only the intents that match with this returned value, will be received by the activity
        See Also:
        AppPublics.BroadcastListener.onReceive(Intent)

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(android.content.Intent intent)
        Description copied from interface: AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        Is invoked every time an intent that matches is received by the underlying activity.
        Specified by:
        onReceive in interface AppPublics.BroadcastListener
        Parameters:
        intent - the broadcast Intent which has been received, and which matches the declared IntentFilter
        See Also:
        AppPublics.BroadcastListener.getIntentFilter()

      • onRetrieveDisplayObjects

        public final void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where the derived class should set its layout, extract all widgets which require a further customization and store them as instance attributes. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        The method is invoked:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity#onCreate() execution, after the parent Activity#onCreate() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment#onCreate() execution, after the parent Fragment#onCreate() method has been invoked.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onRetrieveDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjects

        public final void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                                     throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where to load the business objects, from memory, local persistence, via web services, necessary for the entity processing.

        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this callback will be invoked from a background thread, and not the UI thread. This method will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully retrieved its display objects, and every time the LifeCycle.refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked.

        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, its execution will occur:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity.onResume() execution, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment.onResume() execution, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        When the method is invoked the first time, if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured that this method will be invoked at least after the entity onResume() execution has started.

        It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread: if the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, it is ensured to be invoked from a background thread, otherwise, it is ensured to be invoked from the UI thread.

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onRetrieveBusinessObjects in interface LifeCycle
        Throws:
        LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException - if the extraction of the business objects was a failure and that this issue cannot be recovered, this enables to notify the framework that the current entity cannot continue its execution

      • onFulfillDisplayObjects

        public void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
        Redirects to the initial activity when a redirection is ongoing. The activity finishes anyway if has not been stopped nor paused.
        Specified by:
        onFulfillDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

        public void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This method is supposed to update the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that may have changed. It will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully fulfilled its display objects, and every time the LifeCycle.refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked, provided the previous LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() callback has successfully executed.

        When the method is invoked the first time, it will be called just after the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() callback execution.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onSynchronizeDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • startCallingIntent

        protected void startCallingIntent()
        Is invoked when the splash screen is bound to complete successfully, and that it has been started with a calling intent. Should start the Activity calling intent.

      • computeNextIntent

        protected android.content.Intent computeNextIntent()
        Invoked when the splash screen is bound to complete successfully, and that it has not been started with a calling intent.
        Returns:
        the intent that will be started next
